definitions.definition: a person who sees an event, typically a crime or accident, take place.
examples: police are appealing for witnesses to the accident
synonyms: passerby "witnesses claimed that he started the fight"

definitions.definition: a person giving sworn testimony to a court of law or the police.
examples: deponent, testifier she cross-examined the witness

definitions.definition: a person who is present at the signing of a document and signs it themselves to confirm this.

examples: the memorial service was witness to the wide circle of his interest

definitions.definition: used to refer to confirmation or evidence given by signature, under oath, or otherwise.
examples: in witness thereof, the parties sign this document

definitions.definition: open profession of one's religious faith through words or actions.
a member of the Jehovah's Witnesses.
see (an event, typically a crime or accident) take place.
examples: a bartender who witnessed the murder
synonyms: attend; literarybehold; informalget a look at "who witnessed the incident?"

definitions.definition: have knowledge of (an event or change) from personal observation or experience.
examples: what we are witnessing is the birth of a dangerously liberal orthodoxy
synonyms: see; Moreenjoy; suffer "Canada witnessed a cultural explosion"

definitions.definition: (of a time, place, or other context) be the setting in which (an event or development) takes place.
examples: the 1980s witnessed an unprecedented increase in the scope of the electronic media

definitions.definition: be present as someone signs (a document) or gives (their signature) to a document and sign it oneself to confirm this.
synonyms: validate; notarize "the will is correctly witnessed"

definitions.definition: look at (used to introduce a fact illustrating a preceding statement).
examples: the nuclear family is a vulnerable institution—witness the rates of marital breakdown

definitions.definition: give or serve as evidence of; testify to.
examples: his writings witness to an inner toughness

definitions.definition: (of a person) openly profess one's religious faith.
examples: our duty is to witness to God
